How embarrassing that the United States looked on as other industrialized countries agreed to cut emissions of gases linked to global warming (front page, July 24). Ordering another costly study is simply a means of pushing off our responsibility to not-so-distant generations.

One hopes at least the other countries will be more forward-looking and ratify the treaty. With the United States dropping out, one can only wonder what incentive they will have to put expensive controls into operation.

Any controls would surely increase costs for their industries and their people, while United States industries will be free to go their merry way polluting as usual, operating at lower costs, and thus offering products at lower prices in world markets.
CLAUDE M. GRUENER Austin, Tex., July 24, 2001
